reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was quite good and the location magnificent.
reviews.title: Quite good hotel - Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We booked a twin (double) room and stayed 5 nights.
reviews.title: A great little hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We got room 64 which was located on the 6th floor looking at the back alley of the hotel. As a result the room was very quiet (we did not even hear the bells of Saint-Nicolas du Chardonnet church which was located right opposite to the hotel - something that seemed to bother other reviewers in Trip Advisor). The bedroom had double-glazed windows and air-conditioning of a very good quality.
reviews.title: Very Good Paris Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedroom was relatively small but it was very clean and recently refurbished (note: not so small though by Paris or London standards). The bed mattress was excellent. The bathroom (with shower) was exceptionally clean, good in size and fully equipped.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008
reviews.text: Service was excellent (we got in contact with five different employees at the reception - everyone of them spoke English and were very helpful)
reviews.title: My 5th time at this great little hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly, English speaking staff.
reviews.title: Friendly and convenient

likes.disliked: — Small room (but fine if you only want to sleep in it!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Safe, quiet side street within walking distance of Notre-Dame but sufficiently away from the main tourist drag to have a interesting, authentic boulangerie, cafe etc
reviews.title: I will recommend the Agora St Germain to any friends going to Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room and en-suite shower room were small, but modern, clean and with air conditioning and flat-screen TV.
reviews.title: Excellent value, great location, great room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: My room was quiet, but faced the back with no view. Try to either face the street or the internal courtyard garden.
reviews.title: Great hotel!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'd be happy to stay here again.
reviews.title: Good base for a left bank weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location ,close to all transportation especially the subway system which is very good for getting anywhere in the city you could possibly wish to go. Staff at the Agora very friendly, helpfull, and spoke English so well you would think it was there first language !! The hotel is kept in a good clean condition .My wife and I would not hesitate to use this hotel again.
reviews.title: Loved the Agora

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: The location was excellent. Very close to the latin quarter and Notre Dame where you can catch the tour buses and all other transportation. The rooms were clean but a bit hot and small. The AC didn't seem to work very well. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. I enjoyed my stay at Agora St Germain overall and I am likely to return to stay there if I visit Paris again.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The best part of this hotel is the location, right in the heart of the Latin Quarter. Lots of tourist attractions are within walking distance, including the Louvre, Notre Dame, Pantheon, Sorbonne and rue Mouffetard. There are also numerous great restaurants and cafes nearby, and the metro is close, too. All in all, the location really can’t be beat.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our twin room (#19) was quite tiny, though I suppose the norm by European standards. Still, we weren’t even able to open the small closet without first moving the nightstand next to one of the beds, which was a bit of a nuisance. The bathroom was clean with a larger than expected bath/shower. The hairdryer looked like some sort of odd vacuum contraption, though, and blew out such little air that it took forever to dry our hair. Recommend packing your own. We never needed to request a wake-up call as there’s a church at the end of the street and we heard church bells throughout the day and night. It wasn’t terribly obnoxious, but it quickly became less charming and more annoying.
reviews.title: Charming Hotel-Great location!

likes.disliked: — I didn't have a view from my window.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My reviews on the staff are mixed. The woman who is at the desk during the day is very pleasant and helpful. The one time we asked for dinner recommendations, though, she gave us a card for a place around the corner and noted that it was open on Sundays, which it wasn’t – not a big deal, though. However, the man on duty at night is a lot less friendly and a lot less helpful. Our first night there, we returned after a fairly late night out and were somewhat alarmed to find him sleeping on the bare floor behind the desk! He jumped up, clearly startled, when we came in. Very strange! Also, we requested a cab to the airport very early in the morning the day we checked out and specifically requested ahead of time a cab that would accept a credit card. Asking for this in advance was useless, as the guy at the desk simply went outside and asked the cab driver if he took credit cards after he arrived, which he didn’t. I could’ve done that myself.
reviews.title: Fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, I would say if you are just looking for a place to sleep & shower, the hotel served its purpose - clean, quiet and comfortable with easy access to the metro.
reviews.title: Gets the job done

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once we got past the spartan interior, the overall hotel room was clean, the staff helpful and the beds comfortable. From what I understand the tight accomodations are par for the course in Europe offering two twin beds, shower over tub, etc. .
reviews.title: Love the neighborhood

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008
reviews.text: The Boulangerie next door was awesome and provided a way to save on breakfast costs.
reviews.title: Great location, small but adquate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, I could do without the noisy student element and the dirty streets in the surrounding Latin Quarter.
reviews.title: Lovely small Paris hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: We've stayed in the Left Bank several times and by far the Agora St. Germain was the best. We would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a reasonably priced, comfortable, and friendly place to stay in the Latin Quarter. All of the staff persons were pleasant, helpful, and spoke English. We will likely stay there again the next time we're in Paris. The room was little larger than expected, nicely decorated, comfortable soft bed (we had two twins pushed together), and a good sized bathroom for the price. It's scale and location really make you feel like you're staying in a neighborhood. The Mutualite Maubert Metro is very convenient, as is the market and shops at Maubert, one of the Left Bank's better bakeries (that's saying something) is just around the corner, as are a small grocery and laundromat. Maybe a 8-10 leisurely walk to Notre Dame. Whereas some previous reviews mentioned the church bells, our window overlooked the church and the bells typically did not start until 8 and even then weren't that bad, rather atmospheric actually. Bottom line is if you understand the difference between a small well managed neighborhood hotel and one of the bigger boy chains, and you want the former, choosing the Agora is a good option.
reviews.title: 2nd Stay in 3 months - as great as the first!
